annotation.TEXT: KA-BOOOOM!!! I just felt like doing that.
Oh! An "R" power up! This'll increase the speed of my AWESOME SPREAD GUN!
Oh, and I have no intention of warping, obviously.
I think that last Goomba there actually died due to me hitting the brick underneath it.
What the...?! I know I pressed the jump button there! So, why didn't I jump off?

Cool, another "R"! Oh, but I just noticed something... Collecting that "R" didn't give me any points. However, it should've added 1000, because that's what the other guys get for their power ups, and gun power ups are actually worth 1000 in the original Contra as well.
Oh, that's silly what the koopa looks like with Atari 2600 graphics. I wonder what it looks like as it's waking up from its stunned state...
Oh, but that's right! There was a vote for Pit, so I could use Pit for 4-4! Okay, then I'll go with Random for 4-3!
Hmm... Well, I could go with Samus for 4-3, and then pick Random for 4-4 and hope that the RNG selects someone that I haven't used for a castle yet...
Umm... The lower fire bar here is rotating the wrong way. I checked this later, and this fire bar should be rotating clockwise, not counter-clockwise as it is here.
Okay, now I can blow away the rest of the bricks.
No, thanks. I still don't want the "M". (Is it possible to get a smart bomb, like in some later Contra games? That would be neat.)
Yeah, I took the wrong path intentionally there. However, what if I were to backtrack a bit, since I have two-way scrolling now?

Yeah, six fireworks! Oh, and also, I haven't had any trouble jumping from the platforms that fall only while you're standing on them (such as that tiny one right before the flagpole there), so I don't know why broken balance lifts would be an issue...
Well, the game didn't provide an explanation for them, but I can fire them with the Z button. (There's no need to "switch" to them. Just press the alt. attack button.)
Other votes included 1 for Google to stop breaking YouTube, 1 to rewind the YouTube, and at least 82,052 votes for Google to change the YouTube comments back to their original form.

Huh. Either I didn't backtrack far enough, or once the game decides that I took the wrong path, I can't make it change its mind (I'm guessing the latter). Well, this time, let's take the correct path to begin with here.
Oh, man. Gotta hurry! Can I utterly destroy this massive brick wall between here and the warp zone and then make it to the flagpole in time?
Alright, now let's turn back, while on the correct route...
YES!!! With the help of my AWESOME SPREAD GUN, I was most certainly able to shatter every brick in time! Now, let's quickly get to the goal!
Alright, so world 5 is up next, and I may or may not decide to try playing through the entire world in the next episode. It depends on how I'm feeling the next time I play.

Hello, and welcome back to SMB Crossover! The voting results are shown above, and the alt. skin votes included the following: 1 for Cut Man, Ice Man, or Rokko Chan (Mega Man), 1 for Quick Man (Bass), 1 for Pit (Samus), 3 for Probotector (Bill), and 1 for the barf guy (I assume Alex or Kunio from River City Ransom, even though it's the enemies that go "Barf!") (Simon).
Alright, it's boss time, against Wart! I don't have any vegetables on me, so I guess I'll fill him with arrows.

"Random" seems to be the way to go anyway, but I was thinking of showing off what the Game Boy filter looks like (though I wouldn't be able to adjust the Game Boy filter from here anyway). Oh, well. So, anyway, place your votes for the characters and skins you'd like to see me use in episode 7!
To be continued...

Well, that was very enjoyable. Now, who's next? Random got 4 votes, while Samus got 3, but I used Samus for the world 1 castle, and I'd like to use a different character for each castle if possible...
First, I'm gonna get this power up again, like usual.
Umm... That lower platform with the three coins should've had a red koopa on it. That's another inaccuracy.

Argh! Okay, I'm sure you all saw what the problem was there. After I broke it and the platform started falling, Samus repeatedly switched between being in midair and standing on the platform, and most of my jump button hits were as she was "in midair". I'm considering that a glitch, since Mario and Luigi don't have that issue in SMB.
Alright, now for 4-4, I'm going with Pit, as I said I would. The main reason I want to use a different character for each castle is to see some of the different "Your ??? is in another castle" lines.
Oh, somebody told me that the Buzzy Beetles in this game are immune to most attacks. I just star-slaughtered those previous two, but I'll certainly try shooting the next one I see in this level.
The Wave Beam, eh? That's pretty neat. It's no AWESOME SPREAD GUN, but that's okay.
Well, that sucked! Let's give Zero Suit Samus another try, and test my jump button to make sure it's working...
Oh, yeah. For some reason, I can't change the map skin here while Random map skin is enabled, which seems rather odd. (Why not let me disable "Random" right now?)
I'm not going to break most of these balance lifts, because I think that'd be too risky.

Alright, so Pit rescued one of those armored soldiers that you'd normally find pertrified in fortresses (which could be freed by hitting them with mallets). Also, looks like Pit is searching for Palutena.
Oh, you know, when the balance lift that I died on collapsed, maybe I pressed the jump button during a frame where the game thought I was technically already in the air at the time. It's possible.
I guess I can break this last one, though...
Unfortunately, no. That's a bummer, and it'll probably be annoying for most characters later in the game.

Huh. The next shot that I hit it with after it woke up destroyed it. Shouldn't the next shot have just stunned it again? Well, anyway, I'm going to break the last balance lift again, and hammer the jump button as I do so.
Can't forget the bricks to the left over here! Is the game gonna give me another "R" power up here?
Demo count: 1
So, let's see if I can destroy every brick in this level with my AWESOME SPREAD GUN!
Ah, it's good to see that this multi-coin block is in the right spot.

Hmm... There's a five-tile high jump here, and the game isn't providing an assistance platform. However, Samus actually jumps five tiles high (just like in the original Metroid), so that's no problem!
Well, the game let me jump there, but maybe I just got lucky there.
Alright, so what will the RNG decide here? (No whammy, no whammy, no whammy, STOP!)
Alright, taking the correct path that time led me to the second half of the level like it should, and I'm not going to fool around this time and will just take the correct path right away here.
Oh, now that I think of it, in the original Kid Icarus, Pit can just simply run across 1-tile gaps like those. I should've checked to see if that was still true here.
Okay, the jump button checks out alright. Maybe I just simply screwed up back there? ...Nah. Well, anyway, let's get this power up back here since I can (thank you two-way scrolling).
Now, obviously, I'm going with a Probotector for 4-2, and there was 1 vote specifically for RC-011, so I'll go with that one. Hmm... Original or GB version? I'll go with the original.
That Porcupo masquerading as Wart used to be the boss here, until he took several arrows to the knee!
Okay, I think I've destroyed everything over there. Now, there's a Buzzy up ahead. Can my AWESOME SPREAD GUN hurt it?
Hmm... I wonder how this game handles the "maze" gimmick of this level...
Aw, nuts! Just missed the 6...
Whoa, don't get too trigger-happy in here, or I won't be able to get all of the coins!
Demo count: 2
There's the vine leading to the 6/7/8 warp zone, but I'm not going to take it now. However, I'll probably make a short bonus episode showing it off later, just for completion's sake.
LOL, it picked Samus. However, it's Zero Suit Samus, which is a different skin than I used for Samus last time, so I'm fine with that, and I can still go with Pit for 4-4.
That jump onto the single-tile ground there made me nervous.
Huh. I can have two at a time? Hmm... I think that any "R"s collected after the first in the original Contra had no additional effect on your firing speed, but if I'm wrong, let me know!
Now, it feels like Pit can jump higher and shoot farther and more rapidly than he should, but remember that he's a Samus skin, and that I already have a power up for the long-range attacks.
Okay, let's try this again...
So, the star still looks like a star here, although I'm now thinking that the star's graphics depend on the level graphics and not on the character graphics.
Well, let's get back to SPREAD GUNNING EVERYTHING ELSE! MWAHAHAHA!!!
I am not dying here a third time!
Oh, what's this? A Missile pickup?
And now, this time, I'm not going to break any balance lifts at all.
No, it's an "M", which is far inferior to this AWESOME SPREAD GUN!
Now, in the original Kid Icarus, Pit actually couldn't jump while ducking, but could duck while in midair, so I'm fine with him being able to jump while ducking here.
And... let the carnage begin!
